H0.text: One mole is the unit of measurement defined to be the number of atoms in 12 g of carbon‑12.

H1.text: One quark is the unit of measurement defined to be the number of atoms in 12g of carbon‑12.

H2.text: One joule is the unit of measurement defined to be the number of atoms in 12 g of carbon‑12.

H3.text: One ohm is the unit of measurement defined to be the number of atoms in 12 g of carbon‑12.

A4.text: the mole was defined as the amount of a substance that contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 12 grams (0.012 kilograms) of carbon-12 (12C)

A5.text: the mole was defined by the amount of substance in exactly 12 grams of carbon-12
